subject: Re: JUnit4 and eclipse
msgSnippet: I actually saw that the JUnit4 code does compile, and wont compile if I remove JUnit4.3.1 from build path. However, on the following code: package graph;
messageBody:
I actually saw that the JUnit4 code does compile, and wont compile
if I remove JUnit4.3.1 from build path.
However, on the following code:

package graph;

import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.textui.TestRunner;

import org.junit.Test;

public class MultiAttacherTest extends TestCase {

@Test public final void strongComponenetWalk() {
assertNull (null);
}
public static void main(String[] args) {
TestRunner.run (MultiAttacherTest.class);
}
}

I get this run time error:
.F
Time: 0
There was 1 failure:
1) warning(junit.framework.TestSuite$1)
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: No tests found in
graph.MultiAttacherTest
at graph.MultiAttacherTest.main(MultiAttacherTest.java:51)

FAILURES!!!
Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0

If I add test in front of the method name, then it works. But this
is the syntax of JUnit3, isnt it? It should have worked with the
code above?
Also, if I have a method with @Before annotation, then it won't run
when I run the test.

Thank you,
Ofer.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "James Abley" <james.abley@...> wrote:
>
> On 17/07/07, oferstu <oferstu@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > It just run it according to junit3
>
> Can you post a sample test class that won't run?
>
> James
>
